intro: Doxomma sarcostachys, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10-30 cm and thrives in bright, indirect light. Its foliage is thick and velvety, often with a waxy texture, while its flowers come in a variety of colors including purple, pink, and white. Doxomma sarcostachys is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
